intro: Vincetoxicum xinpingense, commonly known as the Xining false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically arranged in umbels. Its fruits are follicles that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Vincetoxicum xinpingense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
